comment: I enjoy her lectures, but thats mostly it. She is a tough grader. Honestly not my professor in my opinion

Just took this class last fall semester and was easily my hardest class out of the 5. Showing up to class is pointless because most of the stuff she goes over in class doesn't even scratch the surface of what will be on the tests. I would have to teach myself the content and read in order to get an A without her help at all.

Her grading criteria is pretty clear but her tests are not. It was difficult to make an A in this class because of the wording of the tests. She takes a while to get grades back, and class is not very interesting.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tests are tough

comment: Dr. Milligan is tough, but she is a leader. Don't slack off and you will do fine. Make sure to read the chapters for the tests.

How did KSU get people like Dr. Milligan into the classrooms? I had hopes at the beginning of her class but she dashed all of it with her awful style of teaching and testing. You can be the smartest and most hardworking in her class and still end up with a frustrating final grade. It's almost like she sets traps for her students to fail. Avoid her!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She is a very bad professor in my opinion. You basically teach your self the material before class and then she skims over the material not going into any depth so you HAVE to read. She gets very of topic during lectures and she plays movies that have very little to do with the topic at hand. Would never take her again.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Relatively interesting lectures. Her tests seemed to be very random and not much actual info, just a bunch of examples that you had to know what was what. She was kind of rude and is very strict with rounding grades from Cs to Bs and Bs to As. Probably wouldn't take again but not the worst teacher ever.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Dr. Milligan is an overall great professor. She knows what she is talking about, and she enabled us to have great conversations in class. If you do your online assignments and study for the tests, you should make an A with no problem. I really enjoyed this course and learned so many new things that have made me a better communicator. Recommend!

She treats everyone that takes this class like they are a communication major. Makes tests way harder than they need to be and she does not give any extra credit. You are only graded by 4 tests (including the final) and the Revel (HW) assignments. Just make sure you study the Revel because alot of the test questions are pulled from there.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough

comment: Her teaching is very poor, most of the information will have to be read from the book on your own time if you want a good grade. Her study guides and power point outlines are rarely helpful. I would seriously reconsider taking this class under her teaching.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I am a transient student, took this class to help me get ahead for my fall classes. This teacher was very disappointing you'd think being a communication teacher they would know how to communicate information... False! We spent 2 hours and 45 minutes every class watching irrelevant movies that were no help. You must learn all material on your own.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I would never recommend this teacher to anyone. It's the most boring and most obnoxious class I've taken in 4 years of college. She words her questions awfully and argues with her student when they don't understand something. I literally hate this class with a passion.

This professor is very unique. She makes you work hard in personal speaking but I learned a lot about this topic and she really taught me to be a better speaker. I had to work very hard in this class but she gave great feedback and helped me become a more confident and more efficient public speaker.

She definitely knows her subject. Lots of online quizzes through revel, but it's manageable. She can be a bit short with people sometimes. Study well for the tests, they aren't the easiest. Overall she's a good teacher. If you dislike working with other people, then don't take her, because she pairs you into groups for certain chapters. Got an A
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Participation matters--Get ready to read

comment: Wouldn't recommend to take for Communications. We watched movies all the time so it wasn't bad, but if you want to pass the class you better know how to teach material to yourself. Uses online textbook and requires you to complete all the quizzes, take class participation grade, and four tests. Tests are confusing.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: If you struggle with public speaking already, or have trouble with vague instruction, avoid her. She has a ton of things she wants from your speeches, many which you will hear about for the first time after you present. It's not difficult to get an A in her class, but the frustration with her teaching style is immense
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This class is terrible. The highest grade I got on a test was an 84. Trust me, I studied. A lot. To the point where my Mom told me to stop. Dr. Milligan takes three/four weeks to get test grades back, shows movies ALL the time and tells you it'll help on the tests (it doesn't), and she's mean if you ask a question she doesn't like.  She sucks.

I would not take Professor Milligan unless you have no options or are a COM major. The class starts off easy enough but by the third speech, get ready for a flood of questions about your topic, condescending looks and remarks when asking for guidance, and overall awfulness. Milligan is  mean spirited, do not look for sympathy if you have issues.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Dr. Milligan is by far one of the worst professors I've take at KSU.  She was always late to class and rarely prepared.  She shows no control over the classroom and little respect for students.  You'd have to pay me to take her again.

Public Speaking is something that comes naturally to me but Professor Milligan encouraged me to see my full potential. She created a great classroom environment but that only comes with respecting her rules and the other students. Lots of tedious work involved in the speeches but all in all they are not very hard. I would definitely take her again!

Awesome class! she uniforms the speeches in a way so you grow not only in technique but also in confidence. By the the end of this class you will feel like a little family with your classmates! The last day of class was very sad! I only learned the basics of dos and don'ts when giving a speech. This class also teaches open mindedness .

WORST PROFESSOR I HAVE EVER HAD! Doesn't think she has to teach, and makes rude remarks when students ask for clarification. I honestly don't think I learned anything in this class. When you ask for any kind of help she won't make effort to assist you. Make group chat for this class & make sure you take it with a friend. Misery loves company.
Professor Milligan is awesome! She is an expert in her field and knows exactly what she's looking for. Grades are earned not given but she is more than willing to clarify anything for you.

She is very lenient on grading speeches. There are 4 random speeches that you get a 100 on if you just get up there. All she teaches is the basic structure of a speech. If you follow the structure, you will get an A in her class. Really easy A. She does not help with speech anxiety, but you get over it after the first 2 or 3 speeches.

She was consistently late, and seemed to teach by the book. I can say I know how to write a speech now, but I still have no idea how to deal with anxiety while giving speeches, or how to do much else in regards to presenting them. If you want an easy class, this is the professor to take, but if you want to actually learn something, look elsewhere.
Not the greatest teacher but also not the worse I have had. Do the assignments and show up to class and you will get a good grade.

Worst teacher. Please do yourself a favor by passing this teacher. She is very mean, wish I could say what I want to say here, but I know they wont approve BUT PLEASE PASS HER ASAP AND FIND OTHER INSTRUCTOR AND PASS THE CLASS WITH NO STRESS AND HER CONFRONTATIONS THAT SHE LIKE. PASS PASS PASS AND PASS HER PLEASE.

For anyone who wants to enjoy an interesting class discussion, add to differing points of view, bring in new aspects to a discussion, feel mentally exercised and enriched viewpoint, DONT EXPECT IT FROM PROF MILLIGAN!!! She sticks to a script and doesn't enjoy challenging questions. I hate this class and leave feeling deflated every time.

This class was rough. Professor likes to watch movies and will turn on six or seven throughout the semester for you to watch and then leave until end of class. Test 1 is terrible, test 2 and 3 are online, but even with note, very difficult. Homework is "glanced" over, not really graded, but pick a different professor if you can.

She is a good teacher. Funny, and not all the hard if you listen. She pretty much gives you the notes so you don't write anything except fill in the blanks and all the tests are online. That plus workbook assignments she skims over makes her class a simple class. Not easy, simple.

Not an easy A, but if you really give your best you will probably be fine. She is a funny person but she follows the rules, no exceptions. The tests are online and taken in class. There is an easy group project that can help you to improve you grade. Attendance is mandatory. Her class can be really boring but its not all the time. She is ok.

Not the easiest class but an A is obtainable. Workbook grades are easy she doesn't check content just looks to see if you wrote something. Incorporates a lot of movies. There is one group project that she doesn't grade too harshly. Attendance is required, deducts points if you miss more than 4 days. Read book for tests and easy A.

She's hard to follow. She moves really fast through her notes, if you don't get it the first time, she says it's your own fault. The class isn't super hard, show up, do you work, keep up with workbook stuff and you'll be fine. Her quizzes and tests are online. Wouldn't recommend, but it's possible to make it through her class with an A.

Not an easy A but an is achievable if your willing to put in the work. Group project describing types of communication in a (group chosen) county, both individual and group points. Don't let a bad member pull down your grade. You'll need to put in some study time for her test. Over all a good class but is not super easy.

Really pay attention to your syllabus - if you read the text book and go back and re-read the sections when she gives you the topics to study for the test you should do ok. REALLY read the grading rubrics for the projects - she follows those VERY closely and you can do well on the projects if you just make sure everything matches the rubric.

HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE. She gives the STUPIDEST group projects that don't teach you anything. All we did was watch movies in class which I'm not complaining about but then when it came to tests online they were SO hard. I pay to take a college class, the least I can do is get a little learning out of it but this class was not worth my time.

Easy A Kind of class. Only real work is done with the Group Projects. Tests and Final are done Online. She's actually very interesting and I didn't mind watching movies all the time. Take this class if you are looking for something light to take that won't stress you out.
Ok Prof.  The group assignments are ridiculous!  When you're in a class of 90 its really hard to do group projects with 10 people and then she counts off for things she never fully specifys.

If you want to work extremely hard then go for it. She not clear on her assignments. Counts points off for every little mistake. If you ask her why she took points off, she will say your arguing with her. However, you can work really hard to get a good grade. If your not a person who loves group projects,she gives two LONG ones.

She isn't clear in explaining anything, she gives notes like it's supposed to be a race, has an attendance policy that IS NOT IN THE SYLLABUS, talks about random crap nobody wants to hear about. What else is there to say? Just don't take her class. Find someone else.

She is one of the worst teachers I have ever had. Always late for class, not clear on what she wants but expects A LOT, tests are 50 questions and you get 55 minutes, not fair with grading or forming groups for projects. If your name is in beginning of alphabet, youre basically screwed. Doesnt know how to communicate when she teaches COMMUNICATION.

You watch movies all the time but when it is time for the test you will be LOST b/c she never "really" taught any of it. She does get upset & sometimes rude if you have to leave class early. You probably can mananage a B but you will get aggravated at times

Probably one of the worst teachers I have ever had. I was in the hospital with an acute infection for four days and when I got out I still had a picc line in my arm so I could get an iv everyday. She made me present a "group presentation" two days after I was released from the hospital, very rude, told me being sick was an excuse

The tests are ridiculously hard, but they are online and she gives you just enough time to finish. She is sympathetic in some cases but not often. Easy class if you do her assignments and go by the rubrics for projects. I wouldn't recommend her, but she isn't so bad if you attempt to make good grades.
don't recommend her

This was by far the worst professor I have ever had at Kennesaw.  1)PPT's were not helpful, you spent so much time filling in the words she left off, you didn't learn anything. 2) Disorganized. 3) Late for class. 4) Did not explain things well. 5) Tests didn't even cover what we learned. 6) High School curriculum. But reminds you of her education.

She doesn't explain your projects clearly. She flys through her ppt's w/out explaining anything, so she can show a movie that doesn't have anything to do w/ the info tests. By far her lack of clarity and organization in teaching is outrageous for her to be a communications teacher. My advice DO NOT take her!!

I took her four week summer class. Four major grades. Two group speeches. Two Exams. Be prepared to read out of the book extensively. Exams are online and she reviews by telling you exactly what material to study. She is very knowledgeable and encourages class participation. Shows movies to use as examples in class.
DON'T TAKE HER, SHE WOULD NOT CURVE GRADE OR DO EXTRA CREDIT SO IF YOU DO BAD ON ONE EXAM THEN IT IS HARD TO GET YOUR GRADE UP.

If you're straight out of high school you'll be fine, for the "adults" get ready to feel like your back in high school.  A good bit of material comes from the book, so you actually need it.  My biggest concern was her constantly complaining about how behind we were on the content and showing films eveeryone has seen.

Not sure why she has such bad reviews. I really enjoyed her class. Took for a maymester and came out fine. 2 tests and 2 group presentations. The tests can be pretty tricky but read all the chapters and you should be fine. She is very nice and smiley! Take HER!

No Laptops or any electronic devices without her permission.  No reason to take notes unless you want something to do, everything in the lectures are from the book.  Her grading on the group projects is a little tough, but she tells you exactly what you need to do to get an A.

The work is easy. The COM Dept sets all grading for the class. She is very boring and not an easy person to talk to. She does not bend on any issue. She blocks out everything not pertaining to what goes on in class. She teaches off Power Point and treats class like high school. DON'T MISS CLASS. She tracks attendance and show a lot of movies.

.I believe the bad reviews on her were from students who probably didn't want to attend class or actually do work. Attendance is a must to get the notes. Read the chapeters and the test is easy. You take the test at home so any questions you don't know you can look up. Very intresting lectures and do the workbook assignments!!!

No laptops. Doesn't give time to take notes. Notes come from book, but most of what she goes over in class is NOT on the test. DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS. Is extremely unclear about instructions and guidelines.
Not impressed at all! She's not clear on anything. This class is so confusing and makes no sense. Took class because it was required..... :-(

I decided to take this teacher even thought her rates where low. I went to the first class and dropped out. She only allows 55 min on a 50 question test. She doesn't give enough time to write notes for power point and she will not post it on GAView or hand them out. If you like a strict and hard teacher she is it. Good Luck!!
JUST DO WELL ON EVERYTHING AND ULL PASS. ESPECIALLY THE WORK BOOKS AND THE PROJECTS
WORST PROFESSOR THUS FAR!!! AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!

Class is pointless. Make sure you do well on the camera assignment and your speech. Before test write out notes on her verbal study guide and read the chapters if you can it really helps. She changes schedule like five times, but its ok as long as you do well on assignments. She grades workbook by completion not accuracy.

This woman is HORRIBLE. Do not take this class. You will learn nothing and be so confused about what you are graded on, when it is due, etc. She also doesn't respond to any email sent from students (Vista or KSU email) or go over tests after they are graded. Save yourself the headache and pick another professor!
Very vague, we watched a lot of movies but then on the test its chapters that were never mentioned or assigned.
The only class in college that I came in danger of failing!! I put in the most work into this class and got the lowest grade that semester!! Avoid if possible!!

SHE IS A REALLY BAD PROFESSOR. HER TEST ARE WORDED REALLY BAD SO EVEN IF YOU KNOW THE MATERIAL YOU PROBABLY WONT DO WELL. SHE IS NOT EASY TO TALK TO AND IS KIND OF RUDE WHEN YOU ASK HER QUESTIONS. DONT TAKE HER CLASS IF YOU WANT A GOOD GRADE. SHES USUALLY LATE AND OVERALL THE WORSE PROFESSOR I'VE HAD THUS FAR.

Stay away from Professor Milligan! Her tests are SO hard and very specific. I studied really hard and she even gave us open note time during the test but I still got a D on them. She is rude and ALWAYS late. If you need help with something, don't go to her. She does not care anything about the student. She is the worst professor I've ever had.
Do Not take this teacher. The tests that she gives are extremely specific and have nothing to do with studied material. Quite rude and unforgiving.

She is a terrible teacher and doesn't explain anything. Her tests are ridiculously specific, and if you don't read the entire chapter, you will fail. Do not take her. She's late all the time, and is never clear on assignments.
Probably the worst professor I have ever had.  Never on time and her tests are ridiculously worded.  Do yourself a favor do not take this class with this professor.

I took her at Gwinnett Technical College. She was rarely ever on time. Sometimes she was an hour late. She never explained things clearly in class but if you ask her, she will help you. Do your work the best you can and you will pass the class with ease.
